title: slumberjack
author: slumberjack
created_time: June 20, 2022, 03:51:53 AMLast edit: September 02, 2022, 02:33:33 PM by slumberjack
content: Slumberjack's 1st BTC Collectors Coin**Arizona Copper Coin**  [next coin sneak peek at bottom]_______________________________________________________________________________ __________________________________________________________This coin is the first in my series for US State coins! What better way to start with an AZ BTCitcoin Cactus. The more BTC friendly the state = next in line!These are DIY coins. I provide the coin, blank NFC tag (write public address), Certificate of Authenticity(place NFC on COA), plastic case, and an optional transparent sticker. The NFC tag is a concept I haven't seen on here yet, but I think you'll find the end result slick and effective.How To Video:  https://rumble.com/v192xih-how-to-slumberjacks-diy-bitcoin-coin.html   You choose which editions you want! See list at the end for available editions.All the coins have the denomination of 1mBTC or 100,000 sats. Again, these are DIY so they are unloaded.***This will be the only run for AZ coins. I am committed to a max supply of 100 + 2 proofs. My continued effort will be put towards coin'ing future states.***Mintage : 100 - 53 SOLD / 47 REMAININGMaterial : Copper Plated BrassSize : 1.75" DiameterThickness : 3mmWeight : 0.9oz [25g]Denomination : 1mBTC = 0.001BTC Serial : 1 to 100 Price : 0.00175BTC / coin + shipping costBTC Payment Adress:  bc1qlhxp49fpkppzsr45legqh8qj7xvh0gmst9rvkcShipping cost [Includes Tracking] :US Lower 48: 1-4 coins - $4 (~30k sats)5+ coins - free shippingWorldwide (USPS 1-4+ weeks): 1-4 coins - $17 (~60k sats)5+ coins - free shippingAfter payment please DM me the following information :TxID :Qty of Coins :Shipping details : use privnote if possible  Front              Back           Front w/ penny              Serial  CoA w/ NFC              Tamper evident sticker              100 Editions + 2 ProofsPlease reply to this thread and DM with preferred serial number(s)  Editions Available :Code:Serial     Reserved By1      Slumberjack2      markzellers3      Bullion-n-BTC4 __________________________________________________________*Sneak Peek* 2nd BTC State Coin**Texas Bitcoin**  As my Proof of Work, I present to you a sneak peek at the next state BTCcoin. Production for this coin has not started yet. The goal would be to release a select few states every year. With the added possibility of a country-centric coin for those that adopt Bitcoin as legal tender. For the Texas coin, I'd like to offer the option to reserve (for a limited time) the same serial number as your AZ coin order.  This would apply to all complete orders as well as the remaining AZ serial numbers. I'm stoked for this series! It's given me a case of nostalgia

comments.author: tweetious
comments.body: I will take #21 (or lowest #, if 21 is unavailable)

comments.author: tweetious
comments.body: I was wondering... If I apply the NFC sticker on top of the private key (at the back of the coin) and then cover the NFC with the holo sticker.... will I be able to successfully scan the NFC? (due to the holo & the metal coin surface)?The point here is that, If I have multiple coins in my possession, I could easily find each public key, just by scanning the NFC chip at the back of the coin....

comments.author: slumberjack
comments.body: Quote from: tweetious on June 20, 2022, 10:00:10 AMI was wondering... If I apply the NFC sticker on top of the private key (at the back of the coin) and then cover the NFC with the holo sticker.... will I be able to successfully scan the NFC? (due to the holo & the metal coin surface)?The point here is that, If I have multiple coins in my possession, I could easily find each public key, just by scanning the NFC chip at the back of the coin....That was my initial intent. I found that the metal of the coin interferes with the NFC's field. The CoA and the NFC combo fits in the same plastic case as my coin.
